intro: Mariscus leptochloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf marsh plant, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Mariscus leptochloides plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
